conversation.message: Hello Nursery_A, I’m Parent_B and I’d like to formally apply. Nursery_A is my first choice because it best fits our needs and we’re ready to commit immediately if offered a place. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: Apply to my top choice first. Although Nursery_A ranks me relatively low (4th), early application gives me a chance if higher-priority parents choose other nurseries. If rejected, I can pivot next round to Nursery_B or Nursery_C where I have higher priority.

conversation.message: Thank you, Parent_B, for your application and for ranking Nursery_A as your first choice. At this time, we’re not able to offer you a place. We appreciate your interest and wish you the best in securing a spot that fits your family’s needs.
conversation.thought: Parent_B is 4th on Nursery_A’s true priority list (E, D, A, B, C). With quota 1 and only round 1, it is likely higher-priority candidates (Parent_E or Parent_D, possibly Parent_A) may apply later. Parent_E ranks Nursery_A 3rd and may apply after trying Nursery_C/D; Parent_D ranks Nursery_A 3rd and may apply after trying Nursery_B/C; Parent_A ranks Nursery_A 3rd as well. Accepting Parent_B now risks missing a higher-priority match. Since we can reject and wait, and there is no penalty stated for rejecting early, the optimal move is to reject Parent_B to preserve capacity for higher-priority parents.

conversation.message: Hello Nursery_B, I’m Parent_D. Nursery_B is my first-choice nursery, and I’m very eager to enroll if offered a place. Our family is ready to commit promptly and complete any required steps immediately. Thank you for considering my application.

conversation.thought: As Nursery_B, my true priority is E > B > C > D > A. In this round I received APPLYs from C, D, and A. Among these, Parent_C ranks highest (3rd) while Parent_D is 4th and Parent_A is 5th. With quota 1, I should not accept Parent_D now because I can accept a higher-priority applicant (Parent_C) immediately. Also, Parent_E (my top choice) is currently applying to Nursery_C (their top), so holding out via TALK is not allowed on an APPLY; I must accept or reject. Best strategy: reject D and plan to accept C (not in this message).
